de.iabg.mesh
Class NodeConnectionMatrix

java.lang.Object
  de.iabg.math.AbstractMatrix
      de.iabg.math.DiagonalMatrix
          de.iabg.mesh.NodeConnectionMatrix
All Implemented Interfaces:
Matrix
public class NodeConnectionMatrix
extends DiagonalMatrix

This Matrix is designed to store a connection or mapping between two objects of NodeMatrix. The naming conventions used in this implementation are First or First Nodes for the rows and Last or Last Nodes for the columns. This implementation takes advantage of the storage scheme of DiagonalMatrix, which has an efficient method of storing such a mapping. This class is created instead of using an actual map because it uses primitive values, which can be beneficial for large systems.

Version:
September 14, 2008
Author:
Adam C. Dick, BSE

reduce

public void reduce(double tolerance)
Reduces the size of this matrix by removing the corresponding First Node, Last Node, and value of any connection which is more than the given tolerance.

Parameters:
tolerance - the maximum connection tolerance
